column4: So Flannel, I read Invocation, and what is says is that I don't need .bash_profile, .bash_login and .profile?
It said bash only reads from the first one it finds
Well I want to add a command to .bash_profile
II did make my own .bash_profile and put alias l='ls -l' in it, but I don't think it worked
I'll add alias l='ls -l' to .profile, and create my own .bash_profile
then ill log out and back in, and see if what i tried to do worked
I believe ~/.bash_profile needs to be an executable
unop : tis a tad old though :)
Dr_Willis_Wirele : as the following sorta mentions -  https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+question/1770
